attributes.action: Conversion of Narrow Two-Way Streets to One-Way Streets in London
attributes.additional_details: Our petition is vital due to the safety and traffic congestion on narrow two-way streets. These streets are not equipped for safe, two-way traffic flow. Converting them into one-way streets will greatly improve safety by reducing accidents and ease traffic congestion, resulting in safer and more efficient transportation in London.
attributes.background: Our petition urges the London Government and Parliament to assess narrow two-way streets in collaboration with local authorities and residents. The goal is to determine the feasibility of converting them into safer one-way passages, enhancing traffic flow, and ensuring pedestrian and cyclist safety.

rejection.details:
We can’t accept petitions that request action at a local level. 

You could raise your concerns with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
